FacilityName: City of Hermiston Water Treatment Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The City of Hermiston Water Treatment Facility has been providing safe and effective water treatment for the last 5 years while remaining committed to the protection of the community and the environment. We willingly observe the most stringent industry safety precautions to prevent hazards in the workplace. City management and water operations staff have instituted procedures to ensure a safe working enviroment is maintained which emphasizes proper handling and containment of hazardous materials The City's safety planning emphasizes prevention of the release of toxic substances to the environment. In the unlikely event of a release, the plan also indentifies in-house and community-based expertise which will be called upon to minimize the impact to community.                                                                                                                                                                                   The current Water Treatment Plant(WTP) is located a short distance southwest of the core of Hermiston along Feedville Rd. and OR Hwy 207 in Umatilla County, Oregon. Disinfection of water is accomplished through chlorination with chlorine gas. The WTP falls under EPA RMP and OSHA PSM regulations due to the storage and use of chlorine gas for disinfection. The WTP currently stores of chlorine in pressurized, one ton containers.                                                                                                                                                                                        No accidents associated with the storage of chlorine gas at the WTP facility have occurred since it was built in 1995. An extensive Off-Site Consequences Analysis (OCA) of the worst case release scenerio and alternative release scenerio has been performed  has been performed with the aid of the EPA's RMP*CompO and EPA guidance documentation. The following is a brief description of the OCA results.

WORST CASE RELEASE SCENERIO

Quantity

Release:                  2000 lbs
Release Rate:                       200.0 lbs/min
Release Duration:                  10.0 min
Wind Speed:                         1.5 m/sec
Atmospheric Stability Class:   F 
Topography:                          Rural

Distance to Endpoint:             2.2 miles

Estimated Population
within Distance to Endpoint:   1200

Public Receptors
within Distance to Endpoint:    Schools, residences, recreational areas, and
                                             major commercial or industrial areas

Enviromental Receptors
within Distance to Endpoint:    None
Passive Mitigation Systems:    Enclosure


ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENERIO

Quantity Released:                  2000 lbs
Scenarion Analyzed:                Vessel leak 
Release Rate:                          160 lbs/min
Release Duration:                    12.6 min
Wind Speed:                           3.0 m/sec
Atmospheric Stability Class:     D
Topography:                             Rural

Distance to Endpoint:               0.4 miles
Estimated Population
within Distance to Endpoint:      24

Public Receptors
within Distance to Endpoint:      Residences
Environmental Receptors
within Distance to Endpoint:       None
Passive Mitigation Systems:      Enclosure
Active Mitigation Systems:         None

The City of Hermiston WTP falls under Prevention Program 3. The City of Hermiston has prepared an extensive and informative documentation package that covers all the elements addressed under Prevention Program 3 requirements.  The City of Hermiston provides extensive training for all employees who work on the chlorination process, including emphasis on stringent procedures for maintaining the integrity of the chlorination equipment. The WTP is continuously monitored for potential hazards that could affect the chlorination process. When a potential problem is identified, it is scheduled for immediate correction. Some  changes have been implemented to the original chlorination process since t

he current WTP was bulit in 1995, including the addition of alarms for chorine detectors to the City's System Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA). Also, updated equipment has been installed, and general improvements to the system have been made.  In-place safety plans will take every precaution necessary so that any future change deemed necessary will be correctly designed, constructed, and operated.

The City of Hermiston has created a focused Emergency Action Plan (EAP) that will be followed in the event of an accidental release of Chlorine at the WTP. Empoyees are trained in the procedures of this EAP to ensure its policies are quickly and effectively implemented in an emergency. Coordination with Hermiston Fire and Emergency Services and the regional Hazardous Materials Team (HAZMAT) constitutes significant elements of this EAP. The regional HAZMAT team for this area of Oregon is based out of Hermiston. 

 We believe the outstanding safety record of the City of Hermiston and the WTP related to chlorine gas will continue. The City's focus will continue to be maintenance of a safe working environment for its employees and protection of the community.
